intro: Uralepis tricuspis, commonly known as the three-lobed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves with three distinct lobes. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland ecosystems. Uralepis tricuspis is a perennial herb that is adapted to arid conditions and has a relatively short growing season.
